measure.name: add_os_water_heater_mixed_storage_gas
measure.description: This measure adds an OS:WaterHeater:Mixed object representing a Natural Gas Storage Water Heater. Users will be asked to provide the following arguments: 1) Use case; 2) Number of Bedrooms; 3) Number of Bathrooms; 4) Plant Loop Assignment; 5) Tank Volume; 6) Energy Factor; 7) Water Temperature Setpoint; 8) Water Heater Location; 9) Water Heater Capacity; 10) Recovery Efficiency; 11) Heater Fuel Type
measure.modeler_description: The measure will create a new instance of the OS:WaterHeater:Mixed object representing a Natural Gas Storage Water Heater. The object will either create a new plant loop, or be assigned to an existing plant loop. The object will be configured be to use the user arguments. The EIO file (generated upon successful simulation) can be viewed to compare the calculated industry standard ratings of Recovery Efficiency and Energy Factor for water heater objects as compared to the user input values for these ratings.

argument.name: use_case
argument.display_name: How will this measure be used?

choice.value: Create a water heater representing B10 Benchmark standard
choice.display_name: Create a water heater representing B10 Benchmark standard

choice.value: Create a water heater representing NCTH standard
choice.display_name: Create a water heater representing NCTH standard

choice.value: Create a water heater representing BA Pre-Retrofit Case standard
choice.display_name: Create a water heater representing BA Pre-Retrofit Case standard

argument.name: number_of_bedrooms
argument.display_name: Number of Bedrooms in the Proposed Home

argument.name: number_of_bathrooms
argument.display_name: Number of Bathrooms in the Proposed Home

argument.name: existing_plant_loop_name
argument.display_name: Plant Loop to assign Water heater as a Supply Equipment

argument.name: storage_tank_volume
argument.display_name: Volume of the Storage Tank (gallons) of the Gas Hot Water Heater. Set to 0 to have Storage tank volume autosized. This field is ignored for NCTH and B10 protocols.

argument.name: water_heater_location
argument.display_name: Thermal Zone where the Gas Storage Water Heater is located

argument.name: water_heater_capacity
argument.display_name: The nominal capacity [kBtu/hr] of the gas storage water heater. Set to 0 to have this field autosized. This field is ignored for NCTH and B10 protocols.

argument.name: rated_energy_factor
argument.display_name: Rated Energy Factor of Gas Storage Tank Water Heater. This field is ignored for NCTH and B10 protocols.

argument.name: water_heater_recovery_efficiency
argument.display_name: Rated Recovery Efficiency of the water heater equal to the ratio of energy delivered to the water to the energy content of the fuel consumed by the water heater. Test procedures to test recovery efficiency are defined by the DOE in 10 CFR Part 430, Appendix E to Subpart B. Enter a number between 0 and 1.0. This is used to calculate the thermal efficiency. Users wil need to review the E+out.eio file to confirm Calculated recovery efficiency - Rated recovery efficiency.

argument.name: water_heater_fuel_type
argument.display_name: The Type of Fuel used for heating.
